Summary.Abstract: This is Level-2G daily global gridded Aura-OMI Spectral Surface UVB Irradiance and Erythemal Dose product (OMUVBG). The OMUVBG is a special Level-2 Global Gridded type data Product (referred as Level 2G or L2G) where Level-2 or swath pixel data are binned (but not averaged)into 0.25x0.25 degree global grids. It contains the data for all L2 scenes that have observation time between UTC times of 00:00:00 and 23:59:59.9999. All ancillary parameters such as Lat, Long, time, solar and viewing angles are also saved for each pixel. First two dimensions of each parameter correspond to spatial (Lat/Lon based) Grid ID and third dimension idenifies the pixel or observed scene (referred as 'candidates' ID). Scientist can apply data filtering scheme of their choice, average good quality pixels data in each grid and create their Level-3 products. OMUVBG files are available in EOS Hierarchical Data Format(HDF5-EOS). Each file contains daily data from the day lit portion of the globe. The maximum file size for the OMUVBG data product is about 128 MBytes. (The shortname for this Level-2G Global Gridded Product is OMUVBG)

Related_URL.Description: Use the Simple Subset Wizard (SSW) to submit subset requests for data sets across multiple data centers from a single unified interface.
Mirador is a data search interface that allows searching, browsing, and retrieving of Earth science data archived at NASA GES DISC.

Johnson cleaned up Science Keywords and Project. 2017-03-30, Ed Esfandiari - Added BEDI SBA related ancillary keywords. 2017-08-10, J. Alfred - Cleaned up related URLs.
